A replica of Amazon's Audible

Nov 06, 2020 Melanie Hsieh Nov 06, 2020 Melanie Hsieh

This month Iâ€™ve been playing around with machine learning and experimenting with different libraries. On the other hand, Iâ€™ve been wanting to read this new Chinese novel series, æ…¶é¤˜å¹´. It has 760 chapters, each chapter with a few thousand Chinese character. Also, this novel series was highly recommended by my cousin.

This month Iâ€™ve been playing around with machine learning and experimenting with different libraries. On the other hand, Iâ€™ve been wanting to read this new Chinese novel series, æ…¶é¤˜å¹´. It has 760 chapters, each chapter with a few thousand Chinese character. Also, this novel series was highly recommended by my cousin.

And this is what I came upâ€¦

An audiobook that is sort of a replica Amazonâ€™s Audible. Imagine there is a software where you paste in the link of the book, it converts the file into pdf then use text-to-speech recognition to read the characters out loud. How cool would that beâ€¦

Here the the 4 key steps:

1 Find the book online

I found this website that offers æ…¶é¤˜å¹´ in TXT format.

2 Convert TXT to PDF format

This took me a while as there were 760 chapters. But here is a simple snipet where I used the pdfkit library to convert from txt to pdf.

import pdfkit
import shutil

for i in site:
    title = i[14:-4] + '.pdf'
    pdfkit.from_url('http://big5.quanben-xiaoshuo.com' + i, title)

    old = r'' + title
    new = r'./æ…¶é¤˜å¹´/' + title
    shutil.move(old,new)

3 Text to Speech

Here comes the fun part. I used Googleâ€™s gTTS Library to process text into speech. They offer a wide range of language, including Cantonese, Mandarin, English, French etc. I then wrote a simple script to tell the program to read every character from the PDF document I generated previously.

However, the gTTS Library isnâ€™t the newest libary offered. It often skips past a few vocabulary such as â€˜â¼¦â€™, â€˜ä¸€â€™, â€˜é»‘â€™. This made the whole audio book sounds incomplete making the whole user experience bad.

from gtts import gTTS

myAudio = gTTS(text=output_string.getvalue(), lang='zh-yu', slow=False)

myAudio.save("Audio.mp3")
